author: Deleted User
content: I have started writing a more detailed plan for introducing ReGenesis today and realised that hard-fork will be required, in order to add witnesses to the transactions and charge for it, and fail transactions if the witnesses are insufficient. But we can do a lot of preparation to make this hard-fork almost inevitable

author: pipermerriam
content: Make sure to look at EIP-2718 as a baseline for new transaction formats

author: pipermerriam
content: Something to consider is whether we could also use this as a forcing function to deprecate `TransactionType 0` which is the current "legacy" transaction format since the introduction of transactions requiring witnesses will already force all of the software that is making transactions to update how they construct transactions.

author: Deleted User
content: After i have jetted it down in broad strokes (only on paper for now), it seems to me that changing transaction format can be accomplished ahead of the hard-fork, via creation of an alternative tx pool network. such new network can provide some benefits to Ethereum (and to the miners), because it will allow filtering out DOS-ing transactions (they will have large witnesses and quite obvious filtering targets)

author: Deleted User
content: the next step this network can do is to start filtering out transactions that do not have enough funds to pay for gas if witnesses were already introduced

author: Deleted User
content: it is a slightly coercive mechanism already, but it may require transaction creators to be aware of the witnesses, and perhaps wallets trying to calculate at the the size of the witness

author: Deleted User
content: then, we will have a pre-consensus sub-network in which we will re-relay the blocks but under a pretence that these blocks run transactions in the ReGenesis mode. This would allow miners to test their software

author: Deleted User
content: for a while, we can also run a "free" version of ReGenesis, in which we do not charge extra for tx witnesses, but they are generated by altruistic voluntary nodes, and the new tx pool absorbs DOS atacks related to large witnesses

author: Deleted User
content: so some nodes can experiment with taking their "training wheels" off, and run off the preconsensus subnetwork or/and off the new tx pool network, with only having active state in RAM, and relying on the regular snapshotting that would happen anyway

author: Deleted User
content: so effectively, there will be 3 pillars that would support experimental nodes prior to the ReGenesis hard-fork: 1) regular (every 1m blocks, for example) snapshots of state 2) new tx pool networks with witnesses and DOS absorbtion - I am sure miners will connect to it anyway 3) pre-consensus subnetwork publishing combined tx witnesses for every block mined in the main network

content: in the present Ethereum network, soft-forks are impractical to do, but one builds up 2 other auxiliary networks (tx pool network + pre-consensus network), then soft-forks become possible
